With Theo Ratliff on the injured list and Matt Geiger suspended, Allen Iverson outplayed Kobe Bryant and the 76ers used a platoon of reserve centers to deal with Shaquille O'Neal en route to an impressive 112-97 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers. We knew we were outmatched. We didn't have two of our Robert Horry men, but we just knew we had to come out and play some ball, Allen Iverson said after scoring 40 points and handing out nine assists in 40 minutes.
